column1: Bartolomé Masó (Spanish pronunciation: [baɾtoloˈme maˈso]) is a municipality and town in the Granma Province of Cuba.
The municipality was named after the Cuban patriot Bartolomé Masó Márquez. It is the home of the Comandancia General de La Plata
column2: headquarters of the Cuban revolutionaries around Fidel Castro and today a museum
column3: located in the Sierra Maestra mountains.

column2: the municipality of Bartolomé Masó had a population of 53
column3: 024. With a total area of 629 km2 (243 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 84.3/km2 (218/sq mi).
